title: The Routledge companion to Michael Chekhov
subject: Chekhov, Michael, 1891-1955 -- Criticism and interpretation
Chekhov, Michael, 1891-1955
Art dramatique
acting
Acting
description: The Routledge Companion to Michael Chekhov brings together Chekhov specialists from around the world - theatre practitioners, theorists, historians and archivists - to provide an astonishingly comprehensive assessment of his life, work and legacy. This volume aims to connect East and West; theatre theory and practice. It reconsiders the history of Chekhov's acting method, directing and pedagogy, using the archival documents found across the globe: in Russia, England, America, Germany, Lithuania and Switzerland. It presents Chekhov's legacy and ideas in the framework of interdisciplinary theatr.
contents: Introduction: Michael Chekhov- actor, director, pedagogue / MARIE-CHRISTINE AUTANT-MATHIEU and YANA MEERZON -- Michael Chekhov in Context: theory, practice, pedagogy -- Michael Chekhov's work as director / LIISA BYCKLING -- The Theatrical System of Michael Chekhov / ANDREI KIRILLOV -- Georgette Boner and Michael Chekhov. Collaboration(s) and Dialogue(s) in Search of a Method / CRISTA MITTELSTEINER -- Meditation and Imagination. The contribution of anthroposophy to Michael Chekhov's acting technique / MONICA CRISTINI -- Michael Chekhov and the Cult of the Studio / -- Marie-Christine Autant-Mathieu -- the dynamics of psychological gestures / JOHN LUTTERBIE -- Chekhov's Notion of Radiating: From conception to concrete / ANDREW R. WHITE -- Staging the Spectator in Michael Chekhov's Acting Theory / YANA MEERZON -- -- Michael chekhov on stage: collaborations and encounters. brief encounters: michael chekhov and shakespeare / LAURENCE SENELICK -- Michael Chekhov, Homo Ludens / MARIA IGNATIEVA -- Michael Chekhov and Yevgeny Vakhtangov: A Creative Dialogue / ANDREI MALAEV-BABEL -- Michael Chekhov's Legacy in Soviet Russia: A Story about Coming Home / SHARON MARIE CARNICKE -- Michael Chekhov in England: Outside the Magic Circle / FRANC CHAMBERLAIN -- Contrasting Modernities. The Rural and the Urban in Michael Chekhov's Psychological Gesture and Meyerhold's Biomechanical Ã‰tudes / JONATHAN PITCHES -- "Prying Behind the Curtain(s) of the Creative Process": Eugenio Barba's Principles and Michael Chekhov's Technique / IAN WATSON -- Michael Chekhov's heritage and interdisciplinary performative practices. Michael Chekhov and the Visual Arts: Influences, Synergies, Collaborations / JULIA LISTENGARTEN -- Russian Delsartism and Michael Chekhov: The Search for the Eternal Type / ROSE WHYMAN -- "As the Shadow Follows the Body": Examining Chekhov's Creation of Character through "Eastern" Practices / JERRI DABOO -- Cycles of Creation -- Michael chekhov and the yinyang wuxing cosmology / DANIEL MROZ -- Michael Chekhov in German Film / OKSANA BULGAKOWA -- Michael Chekhov the Hollywood Actor / JACQUELINE NACACHE -- Michael Chekhov's theatre system and acting pedagogy today -- Chekhov's lithuanian lessons / GYTIS PADEGIMAS -- Developing the Imagination: Michael Chekhov in Actor Training / LIONEL WALSH -- Michael Chekhov's Five Guiding Principles and Theatre Practice Today: The Case of "Tender Napalm" by Phillip Ridley / CYNTHIA ASHPERGER -- The Legacy of Michael Chekhov: Then and Now / JOANNA MERLIN.
